name: 1.13 "Now Pitching, Sam Malone" Online Trivia | Television | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
1:37.

	Coach found out what time it was and said it was his favorite time. He said there was just something about 1:37 that he liked.

questions.text: What did Sam say his favorite time was?
questions.explanation:
8:15.

	Coach said his favorite time used to be 8:15. He said he out grew it.

questions.text: Who did Cliff say the next president would be?
questions.explanation:
Yelnic McGwawa.

	According to Cliff, you could divide the letters in the last person's name equally by the year they were elected president. At the time of this episode Ronald Reagan was the US president.

questions.text: What did the woman who flirted with Sam do for a living?
questions.explanation:
got male athletes on commercials.

	She only picked men she found attractive to get into commercials. Part of their payment for her was to sleep with her.

questions.text: What was the name of the hockey player?
questions.explanation:
Tibor.

	Tibor was played by Rick Hill. Rick Hill was born January 26, 1953 in Kentucky.

questions.text: How did the hockey player learn English?
options: He didn't, he only spoke in Russian
questions.explanation:
TV commercials.

	At first, the others were confused as to why he kept quoting lines from commercials until they were told he was using them to learn English. At one point he was leaving and instead of "Goodbye", he said, "And this concludes another day of broadcasting."

questions.text: What play was Sam in as a child?
questions.explanation:
"How Boots Fooled the King".

	When he described the plot of the play, Diane thought he was in "Macbeth". I could not find a play by the title of "How Boots Fooled the King" but there is an online story with that title.

questions.text: Why did the woman say non-star athletes were important?
questions.correct: They came across as regular people.
questions.explanation:
They came across as regular people.

	Sam was a relief pitcher for the Red Sox but had not played in a while. He said in an episode many years later, "A lot of people may not know this but I happen to be quite famous." He was number 16 when he played baseball.

options: The Red Sox lost another game
Diane putting her nose in his business
The man Cliff said would be president.
questions.explanation:
His relationship with his agent.

	Sam's relationship with the agent had become very sexual. Sam felt like he had to perform in order to keep doing commercials and he hated it.

questions.text: Who was the director of this episode?
questions.explanation:
James Burrows.

	James Burrows was born December 30, 1940. While he is best known for "Cheers" he directed many shows, including the spin-off "Frasier".
